fields.description:
h2. Symptoms

Deleted users in AD is not deleted on Confluence side when incremental synchronization run successfully. This changes only reflected on Confluence when full synchronization ran successfully.

h2. Steps to Reproduce

# Integrate Confluence using connector method against active directory server 
# Make sure "Incremental Syncronization" is enabled
# Synchronize the newly created directory
# Create a test user on your active directory server
# Synchronize the newly created directory
# Ensure that the users retrieved by Confluence
# Delete the user from your active directory server
# Trigger the synchronization and wait till it ran successfully
# After synchronization finished, Confluence did not delete the deleted user

h2. Expected Behavior

Confluence should delete the user without the need to disabled incremental synchronization. This issue is not reproducible in Confluence 5.1.
fields.summary: Incremental AD Synchronization Ignores User Deletion

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce : 

# Create a page in Confluence with a relative link to another page
# Now edit this page and add a comment in "what did you change"  section
# Check the page history to verify if your comment is showing up.
# After this, change the title of the page that was linked in Step 1.
# The link in the page created in Step 1 gets updated
# Now go to the page history of this page. You do not see the "what did you change" comment anymore
fields.summary: "what did you change" comment is deleted if linked page is renamed

fields.description:
On a Confluence page a user can write comments. Existing comments can be edited. However, after clicking the button "edit" the edit screen is empty. The comment cannot be viewed or edited. 

We use version 4.2.12, but this is not included in the "Affects Version/s" picklist.
fields.summary: Not able to edit comments

fields.description:
Sometimes Confluence fails to create a group with the error message described in the summary.

After trying multiple times it works without any problem after a few minutes.

I could find following entry in the log files:

013-05-21 14:56:36,980 ERROR [http-80-8] [confluence.user.actions.BrowseGroupsAction] doAdd Failed to create group: xy
 -- url: /admin/users/creategroup.action | userName: xy | referer: http://xy.com/admin/users/browsegroups.action | action: creategroup
com.atlassian.confluence.user.UserManagementOperationFailedException: java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect
	at com.atlassian.confluence.user.DefaultUserAccessor.createGroup(DefaultUserAccessor.java:293)

Do you have any advice?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29346].
  {panel}

The _ImageFilterServlet_ writes to the _HttpServletResponse_'s _OutputStream_ in the end. One possible exception could be that the socket gets closed on the client-side (e.g. user closes browser tab) leading to a _ClientAbortException:  java.net.SocketException: Broken pipe_ being re-thrown as -_java.lang.RuntimeException_, leading to a full stack trace being written out to the log. The _ClientAbortException_ is implementation specific, but the part writing to the _OutputStream_ could still stand in its isolated try-catch examining if the root cause is a _SocketException_ of that type and thus ignore it.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Put a breakpoint on l216 of the ImageFilterServlet (ImageEffectsPlugin 1.1.4)
2. Open the _Prettify the page with an image (step 4 of 9)_ page of the demo space in the editor, select one of the images and click on _Properties_ in the property panel
3. Wait for the break, and close the tab, you'll get a trace like the one attached
fields.summary: ImageFilterServlet re-throws java.net.SocketException: Broken pipe
Upgrade bundled Tomcat to 6.0.37

fields.description:
When an image is pasted into the Confluence (4.x) editor it is attached in the format:

imageYYYY-MM-dd hh:mm:ss.png

When using Windows, it is impossible to edit this image and upload it as a new version.  Because Windows does not support a colon ':' in a file name you cannot save the file locally with the colons. Thus, the file name will not be in the required format to make a new attachment version.

The only workaround is to edit the properties of the attachment and remove the colons.

It would be better to avoid this problem by removing colons from the pasted images.  Perhaps with the format:

imageYYYY-MM-dd_hhmmss.png
fields.summary: Cannot create new versions of images pasted from clipboard in Windows
Export to PDF compresses table contents
Office connector should support MS Office 2013

fields.description:
There are two ways to recreate the problem.

Steps to reproduce:

Version 1: Change task status and then edit a page.
a. One a page with a checkmark, mark a task complete or incomplete.
b. Seconds later, edit the page.
c. Save the page, and any change to tasks in step (a) will no longer appear on the page.

Version 2: Edit a page and change task status while the page is being edited.
a. User A edits a page that has task list checkboxes.
b. User B marks a task complete or incomplete while the page is being edited.
c. User A finishes editing and saves the page.
d. User B's changes to task status no longer appear on the page.
fields.summary: New task list check marks clear if one edits the page soon after marking tasks complete

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29338].
  {panel}

Some of the joking aside, there may be some rewarding opportunity for collaboration with or integrating of the Docear suite of tools to Atlassian's Confluence et al. Though the mind-mapping software suite is intended for use by academics, I argue that in this Information Age, who does not need help keeping track of all the details which constitute the Truth of the matter?

Some notes on Truth:
The Google Search is one of the best general purpose providers of truth on the internet. However, the algorithm suffers from certain issues, particularly regarding the quantity of cross-links generated as a result of human behavior (e.g. painful experiences with sub-par technology vs. technology which "just works").

Wikipedia has largely addressed the need to consolidate certain [Google] Searches for truth into a reviewed, standardized, human-readable layout, thus augmenting our ability to understand and comprehend the unknown or unfamiliar. Wikipedia suffers from the inability to test Truth propositions, and so has policies which remove Primary authors from the allowable citation pool in preference to Journalists, or Secondary Sources, who may someday cover the material so that mortals may understand it (or something--I have yet to hear a sensible explanation for this policy).

Both tools may be used easily as consumers, with some difficulty as a producer. However, there is a yet a lot to be desired in the gap between knowing and creating. For instance, take GitHub and BitBucket. Those are social tools for creation of software. Now extend those ideas to logic, personal preferences, and what we do as human beings, and we ought to see some computer augmentation of our abilities to discern fact from fiction.
fields.summary: Integration with Docear

!bug 2.jpg|thumbnail!

See screenshot for available parameters that are being presented.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29333].
  {panel}

My life changed when I realised that 'j' and 'k' would go to the previous and next items in the workbox respectively. Sadly, it was a total accident that I found that out (I was trying to type a comment and hadn't focussed the field). I never bothered to try it because the only visible piece of UI in workbox is a link to go "back to notifications".

I'd like to see you guys implement some forward/backward arrows in workbox, similar to how GMail does it. That way, you will solve three problems:

* Visibility and affordance of the feature,
* mouse users will be able to do something better than "back to notifications", and
* you can educate people what the keyboard shortcuts are (via tooltips on the buttons).
fields.summary: Tangible buttons for prev/next item in workbox

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms

The "Edit" button either shows a blank page, or redirects to an undefined page with the URL "<baseUrl>/<spaceId>/undefined", when the Google Analytics "traditional" snippet is used in the "at end of body" custom HTML.

This has only been happening since 5.0.1. 5.0 and below are unaffected in my testing.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Paste the [traditional snippet|https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/collection/gajs/gaTrackingOverview] into the "at end of body" custom html field (you don't need a valid Google Analytics ID to replicate the issue)
# Try to edit a page

h4. Workaround

Use the [asynchronous snippet|https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/collection/gajs/asyncTracking] in the "at end of head" custom html field instead, as this version of the snippet does not trigger the issue. Make sure to remove the original snippet from the "at end of body" field.
fields.summary: Can't edit pages when using Google Analytics "traditional" snippet in Custom HTML

fields.description:
If a confluence page has two headers with the same text content, the TOC will display correctly however clicking on either of those header links in the TOC will always take you to the first one.

IE:

TOC

-- H2
-- H1 <--- Unreachable from the TOC, takes you the the first H1
fields.summary: Identical Headers will not work when clicked in the TOC

Would like the ability to have several depths of numbered bullets. For example, this stye of bullets:

1. Item
  1.1 Sub item

is currently not possible in Confluence. This style is very useful for requirement/specification documents, where specific functionality can be referenced by number.

fields.description:
If you have a section and some columns with the width defined in percentage format, an you include a table inside of one of the colunms, which is wider than the width defined for the column, the defined widths are not applied. The column containing the table gets wider and pushes the other columns away, stealing their space. In some cases, this can also push some content out of the area to display the content of a page. Sample XHTML: {noformat}10%
afdsssssssssssssssssssssssssss asfddddddddddddddddddddddddddd afsdddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddd fadssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssss
       
       
       
30%

30%

30%

{noformat}
fields.summary: width tables override column macro width within a section

fields.description:
Hi,

I have noticed that notifications like mentioning somebody generates mail, where "from" field is different than it is set up in confluence mail server configuration.

Confluence mail server configuration example:
"From Address" -> confluence-administrator@example-company.com
"From Name" -> ${fullname} (Confluence)

Generated mail notification by mentioning somebody:
"From" -> Joe Bloggs (Confluence) <Joe-Blogss@example-company.com>

According to documentation it should be:
"From" -> Joe Bloggs (Confluence) <confluence-administrator@example-company.com>

This issue doesn't occur when page is shared.

Depending on mail server configuration in company infrastructure, that bug generates following error in confluence logs:
com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPSendFailedException: 550 5.7.1 Client does not have permissions to send as this sender

Regards,
Wojciech Ośródka
fields.summary: Notifications are sent as different user than "From Address" mail server setting

fields.description:

It was decided in [CONF-8877|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-8877] that allowing users to copy to spaces that they did have permission for was ok, but it's inconsistent that we remove one link and keep the other.

fields.description:
1) Create a template with labels on it
2) Create a page from that template
3) Remove the template you created
4) Visit the page you create and remove a label
5) Leave the page
6) Come back and see that the label your deleted is back

customer screencast - http://screencast.com/t/pVeR4leBKpbx

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29311].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
After inserting a link to an anchor in a page, Confluence seems to be truncating part the resulting URL, making the link useless. 
For example, a link to an anchor named "section two" would be rendered as 
{noformat}
https://<account>.atlassian.net/wiki/display/<spaceKey>/<page>#<page>-sectiontw
{noformat}
(note the missing "o" letter at the end of the link).
The issue seems to be intermittent.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Create a numeric list with titles that will eventually be links.  (such as: 1. link one, 2. link two, etc.)
# Create 4 h3 headers with some text, below the numbered list ("section 1", "section 2", etc.)
# Above each h3, insert anchors ("section one", "section two", "section three", etc.)
# For each of the items in the enumerated list at the top, highlight the text and click the link icon.
# For the link, use the corresponding anchor that was just created (i.e., "#section one" or "#section two").
# Save the page.

h4. Expected Result
Links would point to the anchors correctly

h4. Actual Result
Some of the links are not rendered properly

h4. Reproduced using the following environments:
* OS: Windows 7
Chrome 26.0.x
IE9
* MacBook Pro OSX 10.8.3
Safari 6.0.4

h4. Workaround (From Michael in the comments)
Click the "Save" button after entering the anchor destination, rather than pressing the Enter key.
fields.summary: Confluence truncates anchor links

fields.description:
If you are using Java 1.7.x (only java supported from Confluece 5.x), you receive the following error when saving the WebDAV configuration:
{noformat}com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.reflection.ObjectAccessException: Invalid final field com.atlassian.confluence.extra.webdav.WebdavSettings.excludedClientUserAgentRegexes
	at com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.reflection.PureJavaReflectionProvider.validateFieldAccess(PureJavaReflectionProvider.java:150)
	at com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.reflection.PureJavaReflectionProvider.visitSerializableFields(PureJavaReflectionProvider.java:105)
	at com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.reflection.ReflectionConverter.marshal(ReflectionConverter.java:44)
	at com.thoughtworks.xstream.core.ReferenceByXPathMarshaller.convertAnother(ReferenceByXPathMarshaller.java:36)
	at com.thoughtworks.xstream.core.TreeMarshaller.start(TreeMarshaller.java:46)
	at com.thoughtworks.xstream.core.ReferenceByXPathMarshallingStrategy.marshal(ReferenceByXPathMarshallingStrategy.java:17)
	at com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream.marshal(XStream.java:489)
	at com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream.marshal(XStream.java:479)
	at com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream.toXML(XStream.java:464)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.webdav.DefaultWebdavSettingsManager.save(DefaultWebdavSettingsManager.java:74)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.webdav.actions.WebdavConfigAction.execute(WebdavConfigAction.java:105)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:168)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.interceptor.AroundInterceptor.intercept(AroundInterceptor.java:35)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165)
...{noformat}

This error may also happen when trying to see the configuration if you had previously saved one.

It works fine if your are using Java 1.6.x, but this JVM is not officially supported in Confluence 5.x
fields.summary: WebDAV Configuration cannot be saved using Java 7

fields.description:
When clicking on a link to an attachment, if the user is not logged in (i.e. anonymous), they will first be taken to the Confluence login page. After logging in, instead of being able to view the attachment, the logged in user will see the 'Not Permitted' page. This happens regardless of whether or not the logged in user has permission to view the attachment.

At the login screen, the URL will always contain: os_destination=%2Fnotpermitted.action (the page which the user will be directed to after login)

There are no issues if the user is already logged in and has valid permissions.
fields.summary: Attempting to view attachment from an email link will always redirect to the 'Not permitted' page when the user is initially not logged in

fields.description:
Reproduction Notes:

* Insert the JIRA Issues macro
* Paste the XML URL to a search
* Customize the fields to return by specifying a custom field

In my example, I'm requesting: summary, type, updated, goals

It generates a request like this to JIRA:
{code}
        Request URL Parameters :
                tempMax=1000
                field=summary
                field=type
                field=updated
                field=allcustom
                field=goals
                field=link
{code}

I don't think the field *allcustom* should be there. We're grabbing all available custom fields which makes the search extremely slow on instances with many custom fields.
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Macro fetching unnecessary fields from JIRA

fields.description:
When a page contains a link which contains the string '\[::]', then migration can fail with the following error in the logs.  Please also see the attached screens shot which shows the migration failing in the UI.

{code}
2013-05-14 11:24:02,176 FATAL [main] [atlassian.config.lifecycle.LifecycleManager] panicAndShutdown Unable to start up Confluence. Fatal error during startup sequence: confluence.lifecycle.core:pluginframeworkdependentupgrades (Run all the upgrades that require the plugin framework to be available) - com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.migration.exceptions.MigrationException: java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1
com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.migration.exceptions.MigrationException: java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1
{code}

The reason appears to be that the link interprets '\[::]' as an array for the link.  For example, the text could be 'http://www.atlassian.com/\[::]'

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Install a version of Confluence older then 4 (say 3.5.17)
# Create a new page and paste 'http://www.atlassian.com/\[::]' to be the body of said page
# Upgrade to any version of Confluence greater than 4 
# Upon startup, we will receive an error stating that the upgrade has failed to an array index error.

*Workaround*
See [Wiki Markup Migration Fails with Array Out of Bounds Exception|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Wiki+Markup+Migration+Fails+with+Array+Out+of+Bounds+Exception]
fields.summary: Wiki to XHTML migration fails with array out of bounds error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29290].
  {panel}

I've spent some time searching for an existing issue for this, but haven't been able to find one.

The functionality I'd like to see implemented is to add a checkbox option when searching to include all revisions of a page's history. Could also limit the page history revisions to include in the search based on a date range.

Currently, if I want to find some historical notes on a page, I have to go to the page history view and click through each historical version of the page and "ctrl+f" search each page until I find the piece of information I'm looking for.

Use case:
- We have a page in Confluence that we use to track customer leads. Once those leads convert into sales, they are removed from that page. Sometimes the need arises to be able to look through the history of a particular lead which would be greatly simplified by having the ability to search through all revisions of a page's history.
fields.summary: Ability to expand search to include the page history of a page

fields.description:

h3.Steps to reproduce: 

# Edit a page in Confluence
# Go to 'Insert >  and choose a macro with options to edit it (e.g. Status Macro, TOC, Children display)
# Decrease the browser's zoom level (e.g 90%)
# No option will appear in the right side of the edit window of the Macro

!macro.JPG!
fields.summary: Macro Options Doesn't Display if the Browser's Zoom Level is Decreased

Truncate attachment display name.

fields.description:
In Confluence 4.x, if you click on the label for an attachment it send you to the URL {{<CONFLUENCE_URL>/labels/<LABEL_NAME>}} where you can see all attachments with that label.

In Confluence 5.x. that URL has changed to {{<CONFLUENCE_URL>/labels/<SPACE_KEY>/<LABEL_NAME>}}, but in the macro, if you click on the arrow (>) by the attachment name so more information is displayed, the link in the label still points to the old URL.

h2. Fix

Customers using Confluence 5.1 and above can upgrade to Confluence Attachments Plugin 3.6.7 available from the [Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/confluence.extra.attachments].
fields.summary: Attachments macro links to labels are inconsistent
Edit a Table in View Mode

fields.description:
When adding a heading in the info macro, convert it to paragraph and convert it back to headings, there's a chance that all texts inside the macro will be converted as a headings. Please see the following screenshot which illustrates the behavior:
!heading.png!

Based on the screenshot above, the "Paragraph 2" was converted to a heading and the same step is repeated again, and as a result the whole paragraph inside the macro is converted to a heading. This shouldn't be an expected behavior.

Steps to reproduce:
- Create a page
- Add the issue macro
- Put a few heading (eg: h2.) and paragraph inside the macro
- Move the cursor to one of the paragraph, change it to a heading 
- Repeat the above step again

This behavior is reproducible in Confluence 4.1.9 and Confluence 5.1.2.
fields.summary: Inconsistent headings behavior in the info macro

fields.description:
It appears this bug re-emerged (already reported with CONF-11508 and CONF-12356).

1) Insert a new table.
2) Insert a new table row via the appropriate icon in the table toolbar (or keyboard shortcut Alt+Cursor Down)
3) the new row has a space character in every cell.

Ceteris paribus with new columns.

The obsolete space character is preserved when saving the page. It is particularly annoying with the new sorting function (by clicking at the table header), since the space character sabotages the expected way of sorting.
fields.summary: Blank space character inserted in new table rows and columns

fields.description:
The table of contents links to various headings on a page, where the links are of the form: <currentPageTitle>#<currentPageTitle>-<headingName>
e.g.
http://localhost:8080/confluence/display/AP/currentPageTitle#currentPageTitle-headingName

When this page is included via the 'Include Page' macro, the correct URL should become: <includingPageTitle>#<includingPageTitle>-<headingName>

Instead it is rendered as <includingPageTitle>#<currentPageTitle>-<headingName>. This leads to a TOC with a bunch of broken links.
fields.summary: Table of Contents macro generates incorrect links when there is a TOC in an included page
Confluence http log analyzer

fields.description:
Our Confluence queue is currently idle.
The queue should be processed once every minute by default.
The Problems occurs after the update to confluence 5.1.2.
We are using SQL Server Database.
fields.summary: confluence queue is currently idle

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29277].
  {panel}

The current behavior (Confluence not allowing PDF files to be opened in the browser) is a side effect of a security improvement added to the product. As PDF files can be "active content", the behavior in Confluence will not be reverted.

h3. Workarounds:
*For Self-Hosted Instances*
1. Click on cog at the Confluence header and choose "Confluence Admin"
2. Under "Users & Security" choose "Security Configuration".
3. Click any of the "Edit" buttons on the page and find the "Attachment Download Security Policy" section.
4. Select the "Insecure: Display all attachments inline" option and click "Save".

!SecuritySettings.png!

*For OnDemand Instances*
Create a Support ticket at http://support.atlassian.com requesting the change to be done in your instance.
fields.summary: PDF files no longer open in browser, users are prompted to download.

fields.description:
According with our documentation:

* [JUnit Report Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF51/JUnit+Report+Macro]

We should see a screen like this:
!https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/336168429/Confluence_3.0_JUnit_Report_Macro_Screenshot.png?version=1&modificationDate=1239941689783&api=v2!

However in Confluence 5.1.2, we see a screen like this:
!bug.jpg!

h3. How to replicate:
# Running Confluence 5.1.2, create a page, and try to insert a JUnit macro.
# Place the file in your filesystem, and put the full URL there: file:///C:/TEMP/
# You'll see a screen like [this|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/91870/bug.jpg].
fields.summary: JUnit macro, is not rendering properly
Expiry of the Security Token of the Invitation Link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29274].
  {panel}

h4. Scenario

- Users tries to sign up for an existing Confluence-only OnDemand instance, through the 'Sign up here' link provided in the login page (only available on instances that allow people to sign up to create their account).
- The ability to sign up is restricted to a certain email address domain, so users that have a different email address don't see any message about the sign up failure, any message stating that they can't sign up with another email address domain, the page only refreshes and they are not able to sign up.

h4. Steps to reproduce

# Inside your Confluence-only OnDemand instance go to the 'Users' page (within administrative area)
# Go to the 'User Signup Options'
# Select the option 'Allow people to sign up to create their account'
# Mark the option 'Restricted by Domain(s)' and place any domain of your choice (e.g. gmail.com)
# Save the configuration
# Log out of the instance
# Click on the 'Sign up here' link on the login page
# Fill in the form and use an email address that is *not* from the domain you chose
# Click on the 'Sing Up' button

h4. Expectation

Display a message stating that the user cannot sign up with the email address desired and the sign up has failed.

h4. Actual Behavior

Nothing happens, the page just refreshes.
fields.summary: Signing up for an account that is restricted to a certain email address domain fails to display error message
jiraissues macro does not display issue links as a column
Set User Display Name from multiple LDAP attributes

fields.description:
When creating a page in Confluence using Mozilla Firefox, the symbols in the last row of the Symbol popup dialog are truncated. Please refer to the following screenshot illustrating the behavior:
!symbol.png! 

This behavior is not reproducible in Google Chrome or IE browser.

Steps to reproduce the problem:
- Access Confluence 5.x using Firefox
- Create a page 
- Go to {{Insert > Symbol}} to open the Symbol dialogue
- We will see that the symbols in the last row are truncated
fields.summary: The last row of Symbols are truncated when opening the Symbol dialogue using Mozilla Firefox

'Unlike' button similar to 'Like' button

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms

When some custom wiki markup is included in the navigation sidebar with an "include" macro nested inside an "expand" macro, the formatting is incorrect. This usually manifests as all paragraphs other than the first are indented, and the gap between the first and second paragraph is not a normal paragraph gap.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a space and set the documentation theme, or set an existing space to documentation theme
# Create a page with a few paragraphs in it
# Go to Space Admin > Themes > Configure Theme
# Enter in wiki markup like the following, substituting in the correct space key and page name:
{code:none}{expand}{include:TEST:Page}{expand}{code}
# Observe the incorrect formatting when clicking to expand on the navigation sidebar

h4. Workaround

# Create a new page which is just an expand macro containing an include macro (the same as what you were trying to create)
# Change the wiki markup to remove the expand macro, and include the page just created as a wrapper
fields.summary: Documentation Theme has incorrect formatting when nesting an include macro inside an expand macro in the navigation sidebar

fields.description:
Last two EAC outages were due to image processing (specifically applying gaussian blur). 21 http threads out of 40 were doing gaussian blur on some image(s), and also consuming all the free heap.

We should:
# Have a queue for image processing
# Prevent multiple thread from processing the same image at the same time
# Have every thread in the queue have a timeout
# If the gaussian blur we're applying is always the same (image shadows), we should do one of two things:
## Store and display the shadow as a 9 grid (check the image in https://code.google.com/p/scale9grid/) and use that, either when processing the image on the background, or maybe even when displaying on the client itself, although that will be more difficult to do.
## If shadows are not always rectangles, we can use box blurring instead of gaussian. Its faster to process and uses less memory.
# Also, we can process only the border we need to process the image, instead of the whole image size.


*Workaround*
* Starting from version 5.8.x (comes with Image Effect plugin of version 1.3.1) you could set next system properties for controlling internal thread pool for image effect renderring:
{noformat}atlassian.image_filter.thread_pool_configuration.core_pool_size{noformat} (defaults to 4)
{noformat}atlassian.image_filter.thread_pool_configuration.max_pool_size{noformat} (defaults to 4)

If you are running small instances (2cpus) then recommended values would be `1`since image effect is cpu heavy and you need to have some horsepower to the rest of the confluence.

* Starting from version 6.0 there is additional fix which will prevent double processing of images which were are already getting processed (use case: impatient user refreshes page before it finishes load).
fields.summary: Image effects can consume all threads/memory
Popular Labels macro shows labels regardless of permissions

fields.description:
Three different methods can be used to upload attachments to Confluence:

1. Drag and drop (calls /plugins/drag-and-drop/upload.action)
2. View attachments page (calls /pages/doattachfile.action)
3. 'Insert Image' dialog from the Editor: Editor > Insert > Image (calls /pages/attachfile.action)

The 'Insert Image' dialog performs the upload via an AJAX request which has a default timeout set to 12 seconds. Large files uploaded via the 'Insert Image' dialog will return an error "Could not upload the file to Confluence. The server may be unavailable" if the time taken to upload the file exceeds 12 seconds. This message is displayed despite the file being uploaded correctly.

The error message does not appear for the other two upload methods.
fields.summary: Editor 'Insert Image' dialog returns an error despite image being successfully uploaded

fields.description:
In a bullet point list containing inline Java code snippets (mainly method signatures), I attempted to convert the snippets to monospaced font by putting a \{\{ in front of the snippet and \}\} afterwards.

Of the 14 method signatures, 5 failed to convert, leaving the braces in the page.  Saving the page and re-editing the page failed to fix the problem.  The only solution was to use the mouse to highlight the text and choose "Monospace" from the text style dropdown.

There are no apparent differences between the text that worked and the text that failed, e.g.:

    FooDescription.isSomething(String, BarDescription)

would correctly convert to monospace, yet 

    FooDescription.otherMethod(String, BarDescription)

would be left with curly braces before and after (actual method names and 2nd parameter type have been changed).
fields.summary: Curly brace shortcut for monospaced text unreliable

fields.description:
After adding a basic bullet list to a page with a hierarchy like this:

* Point 1.
* Point 2.
* Point 3.
* Point 4
* Point 5.
    * Point 5.1.
    * Point 5.2.
* Point 6
    * Point 6.1
    * Point 6.2

the cursor froze at the end of the last bullet point (Point 6.2 in the example above), and would no longer respond to keypresses or mouse clicks.  Had to save the page and re-open it for editing to be able to continue.
fields.summary: Editing mode stops responding to keypresses and mouse clicks

fields.description:
When adding a Jira User Directory in Confluence, one cannot remove the use permission from the jira-users/developers/administrators groups. This often sends Confluence over license count for smaller license tiers

Reproduce:

Create a jira user directory in Confluence.
Successfully save and test. Sync.
In Global permissions, add jira default groups to permission scheme. They all add with 'can use' checked by default. 
Uncheck can use for 3 groups.
Groups are removed from the Global permissions page view.
Login still capable via any jira group user. 

The whole point here is that confluence-users/administrators groups should be added on the jira side where users in jira can then be added to those groups - which works. But to default / hard code all the jira groups into confluence without the ability to disable all users from accessing confluence is wrong. I should be able to disable can use for these groups and have it persist, then only have the users in the confluence-users group in jira have access to confluence.
fields.summary: Cannot remove use permission from jira user directory groups in Confluence
We are using a test version of wiki 5.0. We are trying to add a calendar, confluence's and the google calendar. It isn't allowing us to. Why?

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Create or edit a  page
# Create any macro on your editor
# Write two lines of text in it
# Position cursor on your second line
# Select the remaining line using "Shift" + "End"
# Try to delete, cut or start typing text to replace
# Not successful
# Copying the selected character is still possible

h3. Expected Results:

This issue is not reproducible using Chrome and Confluence successfully write any characters inputted by the user after selecting the character using "Shift" + "End".

h3. Actual Results:

Input from the users are ignored except trying to copy it.

h3. Environment Information (In the Environment Field):

Internet Explorer 9 and 10
fields.summary: Shift + End Selection on IE Doesn't Work Inside Macros

The same problem happens with links to pages.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29243].
  {panel}

The import process translates sub numbered bullets into letters.  Please see screen shots for examples of the document in word vs. Confluence.

*steps to reproduce*
# Click 'tools' -> 'Import word document'
# Choose a word doc that contains a numbered bullet list with subsections (aka, 1, 1.1 -1.2).  An example copy is attached for testing.
# Save the document
# Notice that 1.1 has been changed to A.
fields.summary: Sub numbered bullets turn into letters when creating page from imported MS word doc

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29242].
  {panel}

Error message is rendered:
Error rendering macro 'viewdoc' : java.lang.RuntimeException: com.aspose.words.FileCorruptedException: The document appears to be corrupted and cannot be loaded.

From http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Office_Open_XML:
"Starting with Microsoft Office 2007, the Office Open XML file formats have become the default[3] target file format of Microsoft Office.[4][5] Microsoft Office 2010 provides read support for ECMA-376, read/write support for ISO/IEC 29500 Transitional, and read support for ISO/IEC 29500 Strict.[6] Microsoft Office 2013 additionally supports both reading and writing of ISO/IEC 29500 Strict.[7]"
It looks like a file with the .docx extension may be either ISO 29500 Transitional or ISO 29500 Strict. Word 2010 only writes the Transitional type of ISO 29500. It looks like Word 2013 could be either Transitional or Strict. See:
http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd797428.aspx
But in theory Strict is supposed to be a subset of Transitional. So if a Transitional document created by Word 2010 works, you'd think that a Strict one would work too. However, it seems that when they standardized Strict they also made a change to namespaces. That is probably the key to fixing this. For more info see: http://blogs.msdn.com/b/dmahugh/archive/2010/04/06/office-s-support-for-iso-iec-29500-strict.aspx
Also http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Office_Open_XML#Compatibility_between_versions states:
"Applications able to read documents compliant to ECMA-376 edition 1 will regard ISO/IEC 29500-4 Transitional documents containing ISO 8601 dates as corrupt."

.docx from 2010 displays normally
fields.summary: Office Word macro does not display .docx from 2013

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29238].

When saving a document in word with no underlining, no Table of Contents or numbered lists, importing this into confluence through the "Word File View Macro" certain portions of the document and sometimes the entire document will be interpreted as 'underlined'.

I've located several other issues related to this:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-24216
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-26741
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/OFFCONN-103
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-25962


Note - This does only appear to occur with .docx files.
fields.summary: File View Macro - Word format interpretation causing underlining
